alert.note: Alert for Eastern, Central El Paso County; Northern Hudspeth Highlands, Hueco Mountains; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern El Paso, Western Hudspeth Counties; Western El Paso County (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 10:23PM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...Strong gusty winds will impact portions of southern Otero, southeastern Dona Ana, western Hudspeth and El Paso Counties through 1000 PM MDT... At 923 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an outflow boundary along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Fort Bliss to 6 miles west of Hueco Tanks to 14 miles northeast of Loma Linda. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and the potential of blowing dust. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... West El Paso, East El Paso, Central El Paso, Northeast El Paso, Far East El Paso, Mission Valley, Clint, Horizon City, Hueco Tanks, Sunland Park, Indian Cliffs Ranch, San Elizario, Fort Bliss, Socorro, Sparks, Homestead Meadows, Agua Dulce, Biggs Field, Dairyland and Butterfield. This includes Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 14 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern, Central El Paso County; Northern Hudspeth Highlands, Hueco Mountains; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern El Paso, Western Hudspeth Counties; Western El Paso County
